events.summary: Following an investigation by the Guardian and Quinto Elemento Lab, Mexican environmental regulators discovered 30,000 tons of improperly stored hazardous material at the Zinc Nacional plant near Monterrey. The plant processes toxic waste from the US. The authorities ordered urgent measures to properly store the materials and shut down 15 pieces of unauthorized equipment. The investigation revealed high levels of toxic metals in nearby soil and dust, prompting calls for further investigation by federal legislators. Zinc Nacional has stated its cooperation with the authorities and plans to address the issues raised.
events.title: Mexican authorities order factory cleanup after toxic waste investigation
events.why_relevant: This action addresses environmental and public health concerns, ensuring compliance with regulations and protecting community health.

events.summary: The Trump administration has announced a significant reduction in medical research funding by limiting the amount allocated for "indirect" costs such as buildings, equipment, and support staff. This decision aligns with the administration's broader efforts to reduce government spending, but has been criticized by researchers and Democrats who warn it could severely impact vital medical research and innovation.

events.summary: The White House, under the Trump administration, has announced an indefinite ban on Associated Press (AP) journalists from accessing the Oval Office and Air Force One. The AP retains credentials for the White House complex but is barred from specific events.

events.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has issued a notice of availability for Environmental Impact Statements (EIS) filed between February 3 and February 10, 2025. This includes a draft supplement for the CP2 LNG and CP Express Pipeline Projects in Louisiana and a draft for the Spring Valley Mine Project in Nevada. The comment period for both projects ends on March 31, 2025. This notice is part of the EPA's responsibility under Section 309(a) of the Clean Air Act to make public its comments on EISs issued by other federal agencies.
events.title: EPA Notice of Availability of Environmental Impact Statements
events.why_relevant: This notice facilitates public participation and transparency in the environmental review process for significant infrastructure projects.

events.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has issued a rule revising the air quality designations for the San Joaquin Valley, California, under the 2012 Annual PM2.5 National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS). The rule updates the designation for several counties, including Fresno, Kern, Kings, Madera, Merced, San Joaquin, Stanislaus, and Tulare, classifying them as "Serious" nonattainment areas. This revision corrects an editorial error in the Code of Federal Regulations, ensuring accurate regulatory information for air quality planning purposes.

events.why_relevant: This action impacts air quality management and regulatory compliance in a major agricultural and industrial region, affecting public health and environmental policy.

events.summary: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) has announced the extension of the Office of Management and Budget's (OMB) approval for the information collection requirements under the Inorganic Arsenic Standard. This extension maintains the current burden of 10,430 hours and a total capital cost of $1,120,896. The extension aims to continue protecting workers from the health risks associated with inorganic arsenic exposure by requiring employers to monitor exposure, notify workers, and maintain records. Public comments on this extension are invited until April 15, 2025.
events.title: OSHA Extends OMB Approval for Inorganic Arsenic Standard
events.why_relevant: This action ensures continued regulatory oversight to protect worker health and safety from hazardous substances, reflecting ongoing government commitment to workplace safety standards.
